events.name: Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan
events.wd_description: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan, marking the most senior US politician visit in 25 years, prompting strong reactions from China.
events.description: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan, marking the most senior US politician visit in 25 years, prompting strong reactions from China.

events.name: Pelosi's visit
events.wd_description: Nancy Pelosi, the most senior US politician to visit Taiwan in 25 years, met with leaders in Taipei's capital.
events.description: Nancy Pelosi, the most senior US politician to visit Taiwan in 25 years, met with leaders in Taipei's capital.

events.name: Chinese government's response
events.wd_description: The Chinese government accused the United States of violating China’s sovereignty under the guise of democracy, with Foreign Minister Wang Yi issuing a warning.
events.description: The Chinese government accused the United States of violating China’s sovereignty under the guise of democracy, with Foreign Minister Wang Yi issuing a warning.

events.name: Pelosi's statement
events.wd_description: Nancy Pelosi stated that China cannot prevent world leaders from traveling to Taiwan to respect its democracy, highlight its successes, and reaffirm commitment to collaboration.
events.description: Nancy Pelosi stated that China cannot prevent world leaders from traveling to Taiwan to respect its democracy, highlight its successes, and reaffirm commitment to collaboration.

events.name: Biden's disapproval
events.wd_description: President Joe Biden, Pelosi's party colleague, did not approve of her visit, stating that the American military felt it was "not a good idea right now" due to high tensions with China.
events.description: President Joe Biden, Pelosi's party colleague, did not approve of her visit, stating that the American military felt it was "not a good idea right now" due to high tensions with China.

events.name: South Korea issues arrest warrant for Do Kwon
events.wd_label: South Korea issues arrest warrant for Do Kwon
events.wd_description: A South Korean court issued an arrest warrant for Do Kwon, the primary developer of cryptocurrencies Luna and TerraUSD, whose collapse in May affected the global crypto market.
events.description: A South Korean court issued an arrest warrant for Do Kwon, the primary developer of cryptocurrencies Luna and TerraUSD, whose collapse in May affected the global crypto market.

events.name: arrest warrant issuance
events.wd_description: The South Korean court issued an arrest warrant for Do Kwon and five other individuals related to the collapse of Luna and TerraUSD.
events.description: The South Korean court issued an arrest warrant for Do Kwon and five other individuals related to the collapse of Luna and TerraUSD.

events.name: accusations against Kwon
events.wd_description: Investors accused Do Kwon of fraud following the collapse of Luna and TerraUSD in May.
events.description: Investors accused Do Kwon of fraud following the collapse of Luna and TerraUSD in May.

events.name: investigation details
events.wd_description: The arrest warrant came after months of investigation, including search and seizure operations at related offices and local cryptocurrency exchanges.
events.description: The arrest warrant came after months of investigation, including search and seizure operations at related offices and local cryptocurrency exchanges.

events.name: market impact
events.wd_description: The collapse of Luna and TerraUSD led to significant losses for investors, amounting to over $42 billion, and contributed to the failure of several major crypto companies.
events.description: The collapse of Luna and TerraUSD led to significant losses for investors, amounting to over $42 billion, and contributed to the failure of several major crypto companies.

events.name: Controversy over shelling of Donetsk prison holding Ukrainian war prisoners
events.wd_label: Controversy over shelling of Donetsk prison holding Ukrainian war prisoners
events.wd_description: Russia and Ukraine exchanged accusations over the shelling of a prison in Donetsk holding Ukrainian war prisoners, with both sides blaming each other for the deaths of 40 prisoners.
events.description: Russia and Ukraine exchanged accusations over the shelling of a prison in Donetsk holding Ukrainian war prisoners, with both sides blaming each other for the deaths of 40 prisoners.

events.name: Russian defense ministry statement
events.wd_description: Russia's defense ministry claimed that 40 Ukrainian war prisoners were killed by Ukrainian shelling of a prison held by separatists in Donetsk.
events.description: Russia's defense ministry claimed that 40 Ukrainian war prisoners were killed by Ukrainian shelling of a prison held by separatists in Donetsk.

events.name: Ukraine's military response
events.wd_description: Ukraine's military denied carrying out the shelling and accused Russia of shelling the prison to cover up torture and shootings of prisoners.
events.description: Ukraine's military denied carrying out the shelling and accused Russia of shelling the prison to cover up torture and shootings of prisoners.

events.name: DPR spokesperson statement
events.wd_description: Daniil Bezsonov, a spokesperson for the Russian-backed separatist Donetsk People’s Republic, claimed the strike was a direct hit on a barracks holding prisoners.
events.description: Daniil Bezsonov, a spokesperson for the Russian-backed separatist Donetsk People’s Republic, claimed the strike was a direct hit on a barracks holding prisoners.

events.name: accusation of US-made artillery use
events.wd_description: The Russian defense ministry claimed that US-made Himars artillery was used in the operation and accused Ukraine of a deliberate provocation.
events.description: The Russian defense ministry claimed that US-made Himars artillery was used in the operation and accused Ukraine of a deliberate provocation.

events.name: CATL Announces New Battery Factory in Hungary
events.wd_label: CATL Announces New Battery Factory in Hungary
events.wd_description: On August 12, 2022, CATL announced the construction of a new battery factory in Debrecen, Hungary, with a planned capacity of 100GWh and an investment of 7.34 billion euros. This is CATL's second factory in Europe, following the German plant.
events.description: On August 12, 2022, CATL announced the construction of a new battery factory in Debrecen, Hungary, with a planned capacity of 100GWh and an investment of 7.34 billion euros. This is CATL's second factory in Europe, following the German plant.

events.name: Project Announcement
events.wd_description: The new battery factory will be built in Debrecen's southern industrial park, covering 221 hectares, to produce battery cells and modules for European automakers.
events.description: The new battery factory will be built in Debrecen's southern industrial park, covering 221 hectares, to produce battery cells and modules for European automakers.

events.name: Strategic Location
events.wd_description: Debrecen is centrally located in Europe, close to major automakers like Mercedes-Benz, BMW, Stellantis, and Volkswagen, facilitating CATL's response to European market demands.
events.description: Debrecen is centrally located in Europe, close to major automakers like Mercedes-Benz, BMW, Stellantis, and Volkswagen, facilitating CATL's response to European market demands.

events.name: Sustainability Initiatives
events.wd_description: CATL commits to reducing the carbon footprint of battery manufacturing by using renewable energy and exploring solar projects with local partners, as well as potential collaborations to establish battery material factories for a sustainable value chain.
events.description: CATL commits to reducing the carbon footprint of battery manufacturing by using renewable energy and exploring solar projects with local partners, as well as potential collaborations to establish battery material factories for a sustainable value chain.

events.name: Renewable Energy Usage
events.wd_description: The factory will use a significant amount of renewable energy to minimize its carbon footprint.
events.description: The factory will use a significant amount of renewable energy to minimize its carbon footprint.

events.name: Solar Project Development
events.wd_description: CATL will explore the development of solar projects with local partners in Hungary.
events.description: CATL will explore the development of solar projects with local partners in Hungary.

events.name: Battery Material Factory Exploration
events.wd_description: CATL is considering establishing battery material factories with local partners to promote a sustainable battery value chain.
events.description: CATL is considering establishing battery material factories with local partners to promote a sustainable battery value chain.

events.name: Local and Industry Reactions
events.wd_description: The factory has been praised by European customers and local officials, emphasizing its importance for regional economic growth and the EV industry's development.
events.description: The factory has been praised by European customers and local officials, emphasizing its importance for regional economic growth and the EV industry's development.

events.name: Hungarian Government Support
events.wd_description: Hungarian officials, including Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó, highlighted the investment's significance for Hungary's economic growth and its position as a leading battery manufacturing center.
events.description: Hungarian officials, including Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó, highlighted the investment's significance for Hungary's economic growth and its position as a leading battery manufacturing center.

events.name: Industry Praise
events.wd_description: Industry leaders like Markus Schäfer from Mercedes-Benz praised the factory for its role in expanding EV production and meeting carbon-neutral standards.
events.description: Industry leaders like Markus Schäfer from Mercedes-Benz praised the factory for its role in expanding EV production and meeting carbon-neutral standards.
